contextId.information: This refers to all the people who live in a house together, usually a large family with servants. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "Egypt" refers to the people of Egypt. AT: "began to rule over the people of Egypt" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Women sat on this short stood as they gave birth. Therefore, it is associated with birth. AT: "as they give birth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Since milk comes from cows and goats, this represents food produced by livestock. AT: "food from livestock" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Since milk comes from cows and goats, this represents food produced by livestock. AT: "food from livestock" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

This can be stated in active form. The word "hand" is a metonymy for the power of the owner of the hand. Possible meanings are 1) "only if he sees that he has no power to do anything else" (see UDB), where the "hand" belongs to Pharaoh; where the "hand" belongs to Yahweh, 2) "only if I force him to let you go" or 3) "not even if I force him to let you go." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Here "heart" refers to inner thoughts and emotions. AT: "he will be very happy" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: he will be glad in his heart

contextId.information: The word "mouth" here represents Aaron's choice of words. AT: "I will give him the right words to speak" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "sword" represents war or an attack by enemies. AT: "or cause our enemies to attack us" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The Egyptians responded to the Israelites the same way they would respond to a foul odor. AT: "you have caused them to hate us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The word "name" here represents the message of God. AT: "to give him your message" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: to speak to him in your name

contextId.information: The word "hand" here represents God's actions or works. AT: "the power I show in my works" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The word "heads" here represents family leaders. AT: "These were the leaders of the families" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: These were the heads of the fathers' houses

contextId.information: The words "my hand" represent God's great power. AT: "use my power against ... show my powerful acts against" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: put my hand on ... reach out with my hand on

contextId.information: The words "finger of God" represent the power of God. AT: "This is the powerful work of God" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: This is the finger of God

contextId.information: Here "my hand" refers to God's power. AT: "used my power to strike you" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: reached out with my hand and attacked you

contextId.information: The word "death" here refers to the destruction by the locusts of all plants in Egypt, which would eventually lead to the deaths of people because there were no crops. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "stop this destruction that will lead to our deaths" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]]) (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: take this death away from me

contextId.information: Here the word "hand" refers to power. See how you translated "strong hand" in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:06:01|6:1]]. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Since milk comes from cows and goats, "milk" represents food produced by livestock. Because honey is produced from flowers, "honey" represents food from crops. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:03:07|3:8]]. AT: "food from livestock and from crops" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: a land flowing with milk and honey

contextId.information: The words "in your mouth" here refers to the words that they speak. AT: "so you may always be speaking of the law of Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: so the law of Yahweh may be in your mouth

contextId.information: Here the word "minds" refers to their attitudes towards the Israelites. AT: "Pharaoh and his servants changed their attitudes about the people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the minds of Pharaoh and his servants turned against the people

contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) "Yahweh is the one who gives me strength" or 2) "Yahweh is the strong one who protects me." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Moses speaks of God as if God had hands. The right hand refers to God's power or the things God does powerfully. AT: "Yahweh, your power is glorious" or "Yahweh, what you do is glorious in power" See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: Your right hand, Yahweh, is glorious in power

contextId.information: The enemies speak of destroying the Israelites by the power of their hands as if it were their hands that would destroy them. AT: "I will destroy them with my hand" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The phrase "right hand" represents the strong power of God. AT: "with your strong power" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The word "Israel" represents the people of Israel. AT: "Moses led the Israelite people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The phrase "in his eyes" here represents what God thinks or has decided. AT: "do what Yahweh considers to be right" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: do what is right in his eyes

contextId.information: The phrase "Yahweh's hand" represents Yahweh's action. AT: "by Yahweh's action" See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The sword represents battle. AT: "in battle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

The hand represents the power of someone to do something. AT: "the power of the Egyptians ... the power of Pharaoh" or "what the Egyptians were doing to you ... what Pharaoh was doing to you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the hand of the Egyptians ... the hand of Pharaoh

contextId.information: The word "sit" here is a metonym for "judge." Judges would sit while they listened to people's complaints. AT: "you judge alone" or "you are the only one who judges the people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The word "house" here represents Jacob's family and descendants. AT: "the descendants of Jacob"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
God's voice represents what he says. AT: "what I say" or "my words" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

The word "voice" here refers to a sound that God made. Possible meanings are 1) "by speaking loudly like thunder" or 2) "by speaking" or 3) "by causing thunder to sound" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Cities often had walls around them to keep out enemies, and gates for people to go in and out. AT: "within your community" or "inside your city" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

Here "name" is a metonym for God's being. This can be stated in active form. AT: "choose for you to honor me" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: cause my name to be honored

contextId.information: To be killed "with the sword" is a metonym that means a person will die violently, or perhaps fighting in a war. AT: "you will die a violent death" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: I will kill you with the sword

contextId.information: This means that God did not harm the leaders. AT: "God did not harm the Israelite leaders" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: God did not lay a hand in anger on the Israelite leaders

contextId.information: This was the brilliant light of God's presence. AT: "The brilliant light showing God's presence" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "eyes" refers to their thoughts about what they saw. AT: "to the Israelites" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: in the eyes of the Israelites

contextId.information: God speaks of choosing specific people as calling them by name. AT: "I have chosen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here the word "hand" refers to the things Yahweh did. AT: "and the powerful things you did" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
The phrase "that person" represents "that person's name." AT: "I will erase that person's name from my book" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: that person I will blot out of my book

contextId.information: The land was good for raising livestock and growing crops. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:exo:03:07|3:8]]. AT: "a land that is excellent for raising livestock and growing crops" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: that land, which is flowing with milk and honey

contextId.information: Since milk comes from cows and goats, this represents food produced by livestock. AT: "food from livestock" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
God's presence represents himself. AT: "I will go" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

God speaks of walking past Moses so that Moses can see his goodness as if only his goodness would go past Moses. AT: "I will move past you so that you may see my goodness" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: I will make all my goodness pass before you

contextId.information: Being seen doing something represents doing that. AT: "Do not let anyone else be anywhere on the mountain" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: Do not let anyone else be seen anywhere on the mountain

contextId.information: The word "Jealous" here means that God is concerned to keep his honor. If his people worship other gods, he loses honor, because when his people do not honor him, other people also will not honor him. AT: "I, Yahweh, always guard my honor" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

God speaks of the offering as if the person was to carry it in his hands. AT: "No one may come to me without an offering" or "Everyone who comes to me must bring me an offering" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: No one may appear before me empty-handed
